title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 3941/86 of 23 December 1986 concerning the quantities of sheepmeat and goatmeat products which may be imported from Poland during 1986
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 3941/86
of 23 December 1986
concerning the quantities of sheepmeat and goatmeat products which may be imported from Poland during 1986
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The quantity of live sheep and goats other than pure-bred breeding animals falling within subheading 01.04 B of the Common Customs Tariff that may be imported from Poland in 1986, under the Agreement concluded with that country, shall be 6 000 tonnes expressed as carcase weight bone-in.
The quantity of fresh and chilled sheepmeat and goatmeat falling within subheading 02.01 A IV a) of the Common Customs Tariff that may be imported from Poland in 1986, under the Agreement concluded with that country, shall be nil.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 23 December 1986.
For the Commission
Frans ANDRIESSEN
Vice-President
(1) OJ No L 331, 19. 12. 1984, p. 32.
